head.title: At U.N. Meeting, Annan Urges Action

hedline.hl1: At U.N. Meeting, Annan Urges Action

abstract.p: Security Council holds late-night emergency meeting, at which Secretary General Kofi Annan demands rebels in Sierra Leone release 500 peacekeepers and pleads with world not to abandon people in that nation (S)

block.p: At a late-night emergency meeting of the Security Council tonight, Secretary-General Kofi Annan demanded rebels in Sierra Leone release 500 peacekeepers and pleaded with the world not to abandon the people in the West African nation.

''Let us not fail Sierra Leone,'' he said at the start of a lengthy debate by the council and a dozen other member states on how the United Nations can reinforce its mission to save Sierra Leone's crumbling peace accord. ''Let us not fail Africa. This time, in this crisis, let us back words with deeds and mandates with the resources that work.''

''The plight of Sierra Leone and its people has become a crucial test of that fundamental solidarity between peoples, rising above race and above geography, which is the most basic guiding principle of this organization,'' he said.
